Benin's failed coup shines a light on the army's discontent

title: French police raid home of Culture Minister Rachida Dati in corruption probe
Violence erupts in Bangladesh after wounded youth leader dies
subhed: Sharif Osman Hadi, who was shot while leaving a mosque in Dhaka on December 12, was a key figure in last year's uprising that ended the autocratic rule of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. Hadi was running for a parliamentary seat in the February 2026 national election.

title: Hundreds swim, paddle off Bondi Beach to honor shooting victims
subhed: Mourners gathered at the iconic Sydney surf spot on Friday to honor the 15 people shot and killed in Sunday's Bondi Beach attack on a Jewish festival.

title: At the Rétrofutur Muséum in Paris, looking to the past to better understand the future
subhed: Housed in a construction-site container and a venue loaned by the town hall in the 13th arrondissement of Paris, the museum shines a light on forgotten techniques and objects to highlight alternative energy sources.

title: After prison in Belarus and forced exile, Nobel Peace Prize laureate Ales Bialiatski remains undeterred
subhed: Belarusian human rights defender Ales Bialiatski, released on Saturday, December 13, after four and a half years in prison, spoke to Le Monde in Vilnius. He calls on the world 'not to leave Belarus in Russia's hands.'

subhed: Populism has never been stronger in France, but there is a crucial difference between flattering the people and serving them, and the Rassemblement National is currently stumbling on that divide, writes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: New York's community kitchens reveal the American cost-of-living crisis
byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent)
subhed: In the world's largest economy, where prices for consumer goods, including food, have soared since the Covid-19 pandemic, 41 million people rely on government-issued food stamps to have enough to eat every day.

title: A French farmer's distress: 'I found the first dead cow when I went to the pasture'
subhed: Near Benque, a village an hour from Toulouse, farmer Christian Lasserre discovered three carcasses on Saturday. He fears a new outbreak of lumpy skin disease and the culling of the entire herd.
